main event: An unidentified object was observed in the sky near Clarendon, Texas on April 18, 1950.
interesting points: The object was initially detected by the CAA observers at approximately 20,000 feet during the noon time., The object reflected sunlight, suggesting a metallic surface., It appeared ball-like with indentations and was silver in color with a translucent quality., The observers lost sight of the object temporarily behind clouds but spotted it again higher in the sky., All witnesses agreed it was not a known aircraft or balloon and could not identify what it was.
witness description: Lt. Col. Lloyd Sallam, Sam F. West, and a Senior-Pilot Corps Pilot who conducted the flight.
